Yes, several other countries are showing interest in adopting similar measures to Bhutan's Gross National Happiness Index. For instance, the United Arab Emirates has launched a happiness index, and countries like Scotland, New Zealand, and Iceland have also started exploring different metrics of progress, such as well-being or inclusive growth. 

There is growing recognition that traditional measures of economic growth, such as Gross Domestic Product (GDP), do not fully capture people's well-being, and there is a need to more comprehensively measure progress. Consequently, alternative measures, like the GNH index, which account for social, economic, environmental, and cultural factors, are gaining popularity as a useful tool to assess progress towards a more sustainable and equitable society.
